name: Homemade Elderberry Gummy Vitamins
author: RainbowJewels
summary: Kids love gummy vitamins, but they often contain artificial colors and flavors or other questionable ingredients. And if you have more than one child, those pricey bottles of vitamins don't last very long. This homemade version is easy to make and fun for your little ones.
ingredients: 8 tablespoons grass-fed gelatin (such as Great Lakes®)
directions: Combine elderberries, distilled water, rosehips, hibiscus flowers, ginger, cinnamon stick, and cloves in a heavy saucepan and bring to a boil
Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, about 30 minutes
Strain mixture through a sieve into a bowl, squeezing all juice from berries
Return liquid to the saucepan over low heat
Sprinkle gelatin on top and whisk until dissolved
Remove from heat and let cool until mixture is warm but no longer hot
Stir in honey or pureed strawberries until dissolved
Immediately pour mixture into fun-shaped silicone molds a 9x13-inch baking pan lightly greased with coconut oil
Remove gummies from molds or cut into pieces
